title: Build a shelf-size vintage computer museum made of paper
description: Artist's collection allows mini Apple II, C64, TRS-80—and more—for the cost of paper and ink.

title: Hacker gets discontinued P.T. running on unmodified PS5
description: New method relies on a transfer from a separate jailbroken system.

title: All DisplayPort 2.0 products are now DisplayPort 2.1, VESA says
description: VESA released DisplayPort 2.1 today, but you may already own certified products.

title: It’s the BOAT: Astronomers observe “brightest of all time” gamma-ray burst
description: It's a "once-in-a-century opportunity" to address fundamental questions of these bursts.

title: $399 Razer Edge tries to make Android gaming tablets happen
description: Plus it has Qualcomm's "new" (but actually old) Snapdragon G3x Gen 1 gaming chip.

title: 37-year-old Amiga platform gets updates to Linux kernel, AmigaOS SDK
description: Amiga's big German conference also happened for the first time since COVID.

title: Kanye West to buy Parler, promises to protect “conservative opinions”
description: West's antisemitic posts got him locked out of Twitter and Instagram this month.

title: FedEx abandons its last-mile delivery robot program
description: A human in a FedEx uniform will deliver those packages for the foreseeable future.

title: Rent going up? One company’s algorithm could be why
description: YieldStar helps landlords set prices across the US, likely harming competition.

title: Comcast wanted $210,000 for Internet—so this man helped expand a co-op fiber ISP
description: Fed up with Comcast and AT&T, Silicon Valley residents started their own network.
